properties.query:
let timeframe = 8h;
let exclusions = dynamic(["SpoolsProvisioning-ApplicationAccount@NAMP111.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM,52.182.49.149", "SpoolsProvisioning-ApplicationAccount@NAMP111.PROD.OUTLOOK.COM,52.182.49.195"]);
// This filters records that have "UserSMimeCertificate", "UserCertificate", and "ForwardingSmtpAddress" fields in the Parameters. These do not appear to have a security importance as the fields are blank. The first two *may* be related to migrations. Forwarding is disabled to external domains.
let ParamsExcluded = dynamic(["UserSMimeCertificate", "UserCertificate", "ForwardingSmtpAddress"]);
OfficeActivity
| where TimeGenerated >= ago(timeframe)
| where Operation in~ ("Add-MailboxPermission", "Add-MailboxFolderPermission", "Set-Mailbox", "New-ManagementRoleAssignment")
    and not(UserId has_any ('NT AUTHORITY\\SYSTEM (Microsoft.Exchange.ServiceHost)', 'devilfish-applicationaccount') and Operation in~ ("Add-MailboxPermission", "Set-Mailbox"))
| extend timestamp = TimeGenerated, InitiatedBy = UserId, ActionAccountSrcIP = ClientIP
| project TimeGenerated, InitiatedByIP = iff(ClientIP contains_cs ":", split(ClientIP, ":")[0], split(ClientIP, "-")[0]), ActionAccountSrcIP, InitiatedBy, RecordType, Operation, TargetedMbx = OfficeObjectId, ParamsModified = Parameters
| extend client_pair = strcat(InitiatedBy, ",", InitiatedByIP)
| where client_pair !in~ (exclusions)
// This is the App ID for the Identity-Graph-API-Connector - believed to be used for migrations
| where InitiatedBy !contains "234797b6-5624-4e53-8f94-45c02d08e86d"
| extend Params1 = parse_json(ParamsModified).[1].Name
| where Params1 !in~ (ParamsExcluded)
| project-away client_pair, ActionAccountSrcIP
properties.displayName: Rare and potentially high-risk Office operations
properties.description: Identifies Office operations that are typically rare and can provide capabilities useful to attackers. Examples include; changing/modifying mailbox permissions.
